title: Top Plant Picks for a Fabulous Fall Front Door
description: As the air turns crisp and leaves begin to change, it’s time to give your front entrance a seasonal refresh. Nothing says “welcome to our home” quite like a beautifully styled front door adorned with lush fall plants. Whether you have a spacious porch or a small stoop, there are plenty of ways to create […] You're reading Top Plant Picks for a Fabulous Fall Front Door, originally posted on Decoist. If you enjoyed this post, be sure to follow Decoist on Twitter, Facebook and Pinterest.
author: Sherry Nothingam
excerpt: Discover the perfect plants to refresh your front entrance for fall. From colorful mums to elegant grasses, these picks will create a warm, inviting entryway all season long.
text: As the air turns crisp and leaves begin to change, it’s time to give your front entrance a seasonal refresh. Nothing says “welcome to our home” quite like a beautifully styled front door adorned with lush fall plants. Whether you have a spacious porch or a small stoop, there are plenty of ways to create an inviting autumn display. Let’s explore some of the best plants and styling tips to transform your entryway into a cozy fall oasis. 1. Colorful Mums Photo Credit: Canva Pro When it comes to fall front-door plants, chrysanthemums are the undisputed champions. These vibrant blooms come in a variety of autumn hues, from deep burgundy to sunny yellow and everything in between. Mums are perfect for adding instant color and texture to your entryway. To create a stunning display, choose mums in complementary colors and varying sizes. Place larger pots on the ground and smaller ones on steps or elevated surfaces. For a cohesive look, stick to odd-numbered plants and group them in clusters. Remember to deadhead regularly to keep your mums looking fresh throughout the season. 2. Ornamental Grasses Photo Credit: Canva Pro For a touch of drama and movement, incorporate ornamental grasses into your front door plant arrangement. These low-maintenance plants add height and texture, creating visual interest and depth to your display. Popular varieties for fall include purple fountain grass, feather reed grass, and switchgrass. Place taller grasses in the back of your arrangement and shorter ones in front. The graceful swaying of the grass blades in the autumn breeze will add a dynamic element to your entryway. Pair ornamental grasses with mums or other fall flowers for a stunning contrast in texture and form. 3. Pansies and Violas Photo Credit: Canva Pro Don’t let cooler temperatures deter you from adding cheerful blooms to your front door display. Pansies and violas are hardy flowers that can withstand chilly nights and even light frosts. These charming little flowers come in a wide range of colors, including rich purples, oranges, and yellows – perfect for a fall color palette. Plant pansies and violas in window boxes, hanging baskets, or small containers near your front door. Their delicate blooms will add a soft, whimsical touch to your autumn arrangement. For maximum impact, choose colors that complement your home’s exterior and other fall decorations. 4. Ornamental Kale and Cabbage Photo Credit: Canva Pro For an unexpected twist on traditional fall plants, consider adding ornamental kale and cabbage to your front door arrangement. These cool-weather plants offer unique textures and colors that can really make your display stand out. With their ruffled leaves in shades of purple, pink, and green, they add an interesting architectural element to any container. Mix ornamental kale and cabbage with other fall plants for a diverse and eye-catching display. Their bold leaves provide a beautiful contrast to delicate flowers and wispy grasses. As an added bonus, these plants become even more vibrant as temperatures drop, ensuring your front door looks fresh well into the autumn season. 5. Autumn-Hued Foliage Plants Photo Credit: Canva Pro While flowers are often the stars of the show, don’t overlook the power of foliage plants to create a rich, layered look in your fall front door display. Plants with leaves in warm autumn hues can add depth and interest to your arrangement. Consider options like coleus, heuchera, and sweet potato vine for pops of burgundy, orange, and gold. Use these foliage plants as “fillers” in your containers, placing them between showier blooms or grasses. Their colorful leaves will help tie your arrangement together and create a cohesive autumn palette. Mix and match different leaf shapes and sizes for added visual interest. 6. Seasonal Berries and Branches Photo Credit: Canva Pro To truly capture the essence of fall, incorporate some natural elements into your front door plant display. Berry-producing plants like beautyberry or winterberry holly can add pops of color and a touch of whimsy to your arrangement. Similarly, branches from trees with colorful fall foliage can be used to add height and structure to your containers. Arrange berry branches or colorful twigs in tall vases or incorporate them directly into your plant containers. These natural accents will give your display a rustic, organic feel that perfectly captures the autumn spirit. As an added bonus, many of these elements can be foraged from your own backyard or local park (with permission, of course). Creating the Perfect Fall Front Door Display: Tips and Tricks Photo Credit: Canva Pro Now that we’ve explored some of the best plants for your autumn entryway, let’s discuss how to put it all together for maximum impact. Here are some tips to help you create a cohesive and inviting fall front door display: Choose a color scheme: Select 2-3 main colors that complement your home’s exterior and stick to them throughout your display. This will create a polished, intentional look. Vary container sizes and heights: Use a mix of tall, medium, and short containers to create visual interest and draw the eye upward. Layer your plants: Place taller plants in the back, medium-height plants in the middle, and shorter plants or trailing varieties in the front of your containers. Don’t forget texture: Combine plants with different leaf shapes and textures for a rich, dynamic display. Add non-plant elements: Incorporate pumpkins, gourds, or fall-themed decor items to enhance the seasonal feel of your display. Consider symmetry: For a classic look, create matching arrangements on either side of your front door. Light it up: Add some outdoor lighting to showcase your beautiful fall display even after the sun goes down. Maintaining Your Fall Front Door Plants Photo Credit: Canva Pro To keep your autumn entryway looking fresh all season long, follow these simple maintenance tips: Water regularly: Most fall plants prefer consistently moist soil but be careful not to overwater. Deadhead flowers: Remove spent blooms to encourage continued flowering and maintain a tidy appearance. Protect from frost: If temperatures dip below freezing, cover sensitive plants or move containers to a sheltered area overnight. Refresh as needed: Replace any plants that start to look tired or past their prime to keep your display looking its best. Clean up fallen leaves: Regularly sweep or rake away fallen leaves to maintain a neat and tidy entryway. Related Articles Budget Friendly Fall Decor Ideas 6 Easy Fall Decor Ideas for a Seasonal Makeover Autumn Palette: Home Color Schemes Inspired by Fall By following these tips and incorporating a variety of beautiful fall plants, you can create a warm and inviting front entrance that welcomes visitors and celebrates the autumn season. Whether you prefer a classic look with mums and pumpkins or a more unique display featuring ornamental grasses and colorful foliage, there are endless possibilities to express your style and embrace the cozy charm of fall. So go ahead, get creative, and give your front door the seasonal refresh it deserves! Ready to bring new life to your home? Subscribe to our newsletter for exclusive interior design tips, trends, and ideas that will transform your space. Click here to subscribe! Sherry is a blogger who loves to live her life to the fullest. She enjoys everything associated with design, décor and stylish modern trends. Born in California, Sherry has grown up on open ranches and in a wild setting, which has defined her taste for design and developed her interest in examining how structures and homes interact with the beauti[...]
html:
As the air turns crisp and leaves begin to change, it’s time to give your front entrance a seasonal refresh. Nothing says “welcome to our home” quite like a beautifully styled front door adorned with lush fall plants. Whether you have a spacious porch or a small stoop, there are plenty of ways to create an inviting autumn display. Let’s explore some of the best plants and styling tips to transform your entryway into a cozy fall oasis.

1. Colorful Mums

When it comes to fall front-door plants, chrysanthemums are the undisputed champions. These vibrant blooms come in a variety of autumn hues, from deep burgundy to sunny yellow and everything in between. Mums are perfect for adding instant color and texture to your entryway.

To create a stunning display, choose mums in complementary colors and varying sizes. Place larger pots on the ground and smaller ones on steps or elevated surfaces. For a cohesive look, stick to odd-numbered plants and group them in clusters. Remember to deadhead regularly to keep your mums looking fresh throughout the season.

2. Ornamental Grasses

For a touch of drama and movement, incorporate ornamental grasses into your front door plant arrangement. These low-maintenance plants add height and texture, creating visual interest and depth to your display. Popular varieties for fall include purple fountain grass, feather reed grass, and switchgrass.

Place taller grasses in the back of your arrangement and shorter ones in front. The graceful swaying of the grass blades in the autumn breeze will add a dynamic element to your entryway. Pair ornamental grasses with mums or other fall flowers for a stunning contrast in texture and form.

3. Pansies and Violas

Don’t let cooler temperatures deter you from adding cheerful blooms to your front door display. Pansies and violas are hardy flowers that can withstand chilly nights and even light frosts. These charming little flowers come in a wide range of colors, including rich purples, oranges, and yellows – perfect for a fall color palette.

Plant pansies and violas in window boxes, hanging baskets, or small containers near your front door. Their delicate blooms will add a soft, whimsical touch to your autumn arrangement. For maximum impact, choose colors that complement your home’s exterior and other fall decorations.

4. Ornamental Kale and Cabbage

For an unexpected twist on traditional fall plants, consider adding ornamental kale and cabbage to your front door arrangement. These cool-weather plants offer unique textures and colors that can really make your display stand out. With their ruffled leaves in shades of purple, pink, and green, they add an interesting architectural element to any container.

Mix ornamental kale and cabbage with other fall plants for a diverse and eye-catching display. Their bold leaves provide a beautiful contrast to delicate flowers and wispy grasses. As an added bonus, these plants become even more vibrant as temperatures drop, ensuring your front door looks fresh well into the autumn season.

5. Autumn-Hued Foliage Plants

While flowers are often the stars of the show, don’t overlook the power of foliage plants to create a rich, layered look in your fall front door display. Plants with leaves in warm autumn hues can add depth and interest to your arrangement. Consider options like coleus, heuchera, and sweet potato vine for pops of burgundy, orange, and gold.

Use these foliage plants as “fillers” in your containers, placing them between showier blooms or grasses. Their colorful leaves will help tie your arrangement together and create a cohesive autumn palette. Mix and match different leaf shapes and sizes for added visual interest.

6. Seasonal Berries and Branches

To truly capture the essence of fall, incorporate some natural elements into your front door plant display. Berry-producing plants like beautyberry or winterberry holly can add pops of color and a touch of whimsy to your arrangement. Similarly, branches from trees with colorful fall foliage can be used to add height and structure to your containers.

Arrange berry branches or colorful twigs in tall vases or incorporate them directly into your plant containers. These natural accents will give your display a rustic, organic feel that perfectly captures the autumn spirit. As an added bonus, many of these elements can be foraged from your own backyard or local park (with permission, of course).

Creating the Perfect Fall Front Door Display: Tips and Tricks

Now that we’ve explored some of the best plants for your autumn entryway, let’s discuss how to put it all together for maximum impact. Here are some tips to help you create a cohesive and inviting fall front door display:

  1. Choose a color scheme: Select 2-3 main colors that complement your home’s exterior and stick to them throughout your display. This will create a polished, intentional look.
  2. Vary container sizes and heights: Use a mix of tall, medium, and short containers to create visual interest and draw the eye upward.
  3. Layer your plants: Place taller plants in the back, medium-height plants in the middle, and shorter plants or trailing varieties in the front of your containers.
  4. Don’t forget texture: Combine plants with different leaf shapes and textures for a rich, dynamic display.
  5. Add non-plant elements: Incorporate pumpkins, gourds, or fall-themed decor items to enhance the seasonal feel of your display.
  6. Consider symmetry: For a classic look, create matching arrangements on either side of your front door.
  7. Light it up: Add some outdoor lighting to showcase your beautiful fall display even after the sun goes down.

Maintaining Your Fall Front Door Plants

To keep your autumn entryway looking fresh all season long, follow these simple maintenance tips:

  1. Water regularly: Most fall plants prefer consistently moist soil but be careful not to overwater.
  2. Deadhead flowers: Remove spent blooms to encourage continued flowering and maintain a tidy appearance.
  3. Protect from frost: If temperatures dip below freezing, cover sensitive plants or move containers to a sheltered area overnight.
  4. Refresh as needed: Replace any plants that start to look tired or past their prime to keep your display looking its best.
  5. Clean up fallen leaves: Regularly sweep or rake away fallen leaves to maintain a neat and tidy entryway.

Related Articles

  • Budget Friendly Fall Decor Ideas
  • 6 Easy Fall Decor Ideas for a Seasonal Makeover
  • Autumn Palette: Home Color Schemes Inspired by Fall

By following these tips and incorporating a variety of beautiful fall plants, you can create a warm and inviting front entrance that welcomes visitors and celebrates the autumn season. Whether you prefer a classic look with mums and pumpkins or a more unique display featuring ornamental grasses and colorful foliage, there are endless possibilities to express your style and embrace the cozy charm of fall. So go ahead, get creative, and give your front door the seasonal refresh it deserves!

Ready to bring new life to your home? Subscribe to our newsletter for exclusive interior design tips, trends, and ideas that will transform your space. Click here to subscribe!

Sherry is a blogger who loves to live her life to the fullest. She enjoys everything associated with design, décor and stylish modern trends.
